foreboding:
不吉利的预兆 
an omen, prediction, or presentiment especially of coming evil; portent
lofty:
高耸的 
rising to a great height; very tall and impressive

崇高的 
very high and good; deserving to be admired
mockery:
嘲笑；讥笑；嘲弄 
behavior or speech that makes fun of someone or something in a hurtful way; mocking 
behavior or speech

嘲笑对象；笑柄 
a person or thing receiving or deserving ridicule
despoil:
掠夺 
to forcefully take what is valuable from (a place)

破坏 
to severely damage or ruin (a place) 
88
imperial:
帝王的 
of or relating to an empire or an emperor

英制的 
of or belonging to the British Imperial System of weights and measures
momentary:
短暂的 
lasting a very short time; lasting only a moment
unsettling:
使人不安的 
making you upset, nervous, worried, etc.
forgo:
放弃 
to give up the use or enjoyment of (something)
waddle:
摇摇摆摆地走 
to walk with short steps while moving from side to side like a duck

摇摆的步子 
an awkward clumsy swaying gait
communal:
公共的，共同的 
shared or used by members of a group or community
disparity:
明显差异 
a noticeable and often unfair difference between people or things
diffident:
缺乏自信的 
lacking confidence; not feeling comfortable around people

谦虚谨慎的 
very careful about acting or speaking
commodious:
宽敞的 
having a lot of space
uppermost:
最重要的，最高的 
highest in position or importance
fidget:
坐立不安；烦躁 
to make a lot of small movements because you are nervous, bored, etc.; to move or act in a 
nervous or restless way
haze:
变朦胧 
to make hazy, dull, or cloudy

薄雾 
dust, smoke, or mist that has filled the air so that you cannot see clearly
emancipate:
解放 
to free (someone) from someone else's control or power 
89
boast:
自夸；自吹自擂 
to talk with too much pride about something that you have or can do

拥有值得自豪的东西 
to have something that is impressive and that you can be proud of

夸耀；夸口 
something that a person talks about in a very proud way, often to seem more important or clever
nascent:
新生的；萌芽的；未成熟的 
beginning to exist; not yet fully developed
placid:
平静的 
not moving much; calm and steady
reproach:
责备 
to speak in an angry and critical way to (someone); to express disapproval or 
disappointment to (someone)
censure:
严厉的批评；斥责；谴责 
strong criticism

公开地严厉斥责，谴责 
to criticize somebody severely, and often publicly, because of something they have done
suspend:
悬挂 
to hang something so that it is free on all sides except at the point of support

使暂停 
to stop (something) for a usually short period of time
permeate:
透过；弥漫 
to pass or spread through (something)
altruism:
利他主义；利他；无私 
the fact of caring about the needs and happiness of other people more than your own
venue:
聚会地点如音乐厅、体育比赛场馆、会场 
a place where people meet for an organized event, for example a concert, sporting event or conference 
90
fussy:
爱挑剔的，难以取悦的 
very careful or too careful about choosing or accepting things; hard to please
gospel:
福音耶稣的事迹和教诲 
the life and teaching of Jesus as explained in the Bible

信条，真理 
something that is believed to be definitely true
subdue:
克制 
to get control of (something, such as a strong emotion)

征服 
to get control of (a violent or dangerous person or group) by using force, punishment, etc.
sanitary:
卫生的 
of or relating to good health or protection from dirt, infection, disease, etc.
obstruct:
阻挡；阻塞；遮断 
to block a road, an entrance, a passage, etc. so that people cannot get through, see past, etc.

故意 妨碍，阻挠，阻碍 
to prevent somebody/something from doing something or making progress, especially 
when this is done deliberately
condescending:
表现出优越感的；居高临下的 
behaving as though you are more important and more intelligent than other people
folly:
愚蠢；愚笨；愚蠢的想法或事情、行为 
a lack of good judgement; the fact of doing something stupid; an activity or idea that shows 
a lack of judgement
resort:
诉诸，采取 
to do or use (something) especially because no other choices are possible

度假胜地 
a place where people go for vacations
plagiarize:
抄袭，剽窃 
to use the words or ideas of another person as if they were your own words or ideas
ameliorate:
改善 
to make (something, such as a problem) better, less painful, etc. 
91
phantom:
幽灵 
the soul of a dead person thought of as living in an unseen world or as appearing to living 
people; ghost
watchdog:
监察人员 ；监察委员会 
a person or organization that makes sure that companies, governments, etc., are not doing 
anything illegal or wrong
coincide:
同时发生，巧合 
to happen at the same time as something else

想法、意见等相同；相符；极为类似 
(of ideas, opinions, etc.) to be the same or very similar
apartheid:
南非曾经施行的种族隔离 
(in South Africa) a policy or system of segregation or discrimination on grounds of race
revert:
回复到以前的状态、制度或行为，重提某个话题 
to go back or return to (an earlier state, condition, situation, etc.)
pedantic:
学究气的，迂腐的 
narrowly, stodgily, and often ostentatiously learned
locomotion:
移动力 ；运动 力 
movement or the ability to move
vanity:
虚荣心 
something (such as a belief or a way of behaving) which shows that you have too much 
pride in yourself, your social status, etc.

浮华；空虚；无价值的东西 
the quality of being worthless or unimportant when compared to very serious things
idiosyncratic:
乖僻的；怪异的 
peculiar to the individual, unusual
encroach:
侵犯 
to gradually take or begin to use or affect something that belongs to someone else or that 
someone else is using
enshroud:
遮蔽；掩盖；笼罩 
to cover or surround something completely so that it cannot be seen or understood
posterior:
在后面的；在后部的 
situated behind something or at the back of something

臀部 
the part of your body that you sit on; your bottom 
92
pigmentation:
色素沉着；天然颜色 
the presence of pigments in skin, hair, leaves, etc. that causes them to be a particular colour
engrain:
使根深蒂固 
to firmly fix or establish (a habit, belief, or attitude) in a person
dictatorship:
独裁 
rule by a dictator; rule, control, or leadership by one person with total power
spectator:
观众 
a person who watches an event, show, game, activity, etc., often as part of an audience
presumptuous:
专横的 
too confident especially in a way that is rude
supplant:
代替；排挤 
to take the place of (someone or something that is old or no longer used or accepted)
downplay:
对 轻描淡写 
to make (something) seem smaller or less important
disinterested:
公正的，无私的 
not influenced by personal feelings, opinions, or concerns
trifle:
浪费；虚度 
to treat or deal with (someone or something) in a way that shows a lack of proper respect 
or seriousness

琐事；微不足道的东西 
something that does not have much value or importance
testimony:
证据 
proof or evidence that something exists or is true
dispatch:
派遣 
the act of sending someone or something to a particular place for a particular purpose

发送 
to send (someone or something) quickly to a particular place for a particular purpose
waylay:
拦截；伏击 
to stop (someone who is going somewhere); to attack (someone or something) by surprise 
from a hidden place
pretension:
虚饰；虚夸 
the act of trying to appear more important, intelligent, etc. than you are in order to impress 
other people

自命；声称；标榜 
a claim to be or to do something 
93
abstain:
投票时弃权 
to choose not to use a vote, either in favour of or against something

戒；戒除 
to decide not to do something, especially something you like or enjoy, because it is bad for 
your health or considered morally wrong
hereditary:
遗传性 的 
passed or able to be passed from parent to child before birth

世袭的 
holding a position or title that was passed on from your parent or an older relative
proxy:
代表权 
power or authority that is given to allow a person to act for someone else

代表人 
a person who is given the power or authority to do something (such as to vote) for 
someone else
rhetoric:
修辞；运用语言的技能 
the art or skill of speaking or writing formally and effectively especially as a way to 
persuade or influence people
abode:
住所；家 
the place where somebody lives
malevolent:
有恶意的；有坏心肠的 
having or showing a desire to harm other people
expatriate:
侨民 
a person who lives in a foreign country

流放，使移居国外 
to withdraw (oneself) from residence in or allegiance to one's native country 
to and fro 来回地，往复地 
forward and backward
dissension:
纠纷，争吵 
disagreement that causes the people in a group to argue about something that is important 
to them
disguise:
掩饰，假装 
to hide (something) so that it will not be seen or noticed

伪装 
to change the usual appearance, sound, taste, etc., of (someone or something) so that 
people will not recognize that person or thing 
94
satire:
讽刺 
a way of using humor to show that someone or something is foolish, weak, bad, 
etc.; humor that shows the weaknesses or bad qualities of a person, government, society, 
etc.

讽刺作品 
a literary work in which vices, follies, stupidities, abuses, etc. are held up to ridicule and contempt
ostentatious:
招摇的 
displaying wealth, knowledge, etc., in a way that is meant to attract attention, admiration, 
or envy
temptation:
诱惑，引诱；诱惑物，诱因 
a strong urge or desire to have or do something
fling:
尤指生气地扔，掷，抛，丢 
to throw somebody/something somewhere with force, especially because you are angry

急伸，猛动 尤指头或手臂 
to move yourself or part of your body suddenly and with a lot of force

一阵尽情欢乐；一时的放纵 
a short period of enjoyment when you do not allow yourself to worry or think seriously 
about anything
apocalyptic:
似末世的；像世界末日的 
resembling the end of the world; momentous or catastrophic

描述 历史 大动乱的；预示未来大灾变的 
describing very serious damage and destruction in past or future events
rebut:
反驳，驳斥 指控或批评 
to prove (something) is false by using arguments or evidence
tornado:
龙卷风；旋风 
a violent storm with very strong winds which move in a circle
dart:
投射目光 
to look suddenly and briefly at (something or someone)

飞奔，猛冲 
to run or move quickly or suddenly in a particular direction or to a particular place
debase:
降低 的价值；败坏 的名誉 
to make somebody/something less valuable or respected
contingent:
随情况而改变的 
depending on something else that might or might not happen
